data.title: Cool Stop
data.text: Very "art deco" courthouse. Great architecture outside and throughout inside. Amazing work on every floor. Must pass through security to gain access.

data.title: Stunning prairie style building!
data.text: One of the more beautiful buildings you will see anywhere. Take time to walk around the building both inside and outside. Work is currently being done on the exterior. Entrance through security is on the north side of the building. Take an hour to explore even though you could spend much more time.

data.title: Whenever we go to Sioux City
data.text: I married a Sioux City young man over 50 years ago. So whenever we go I try to see the Woodbury County Courthouse. I had never seen this type of architecture and each time I go I find something different. You can see the influence of our world famous architect Frank Lloyd Wright in this early Prairie Gothic building.  The men who studied under Wright then went on to build this unique & for me beautiful building have left a rich heritage to the people of Sioux City. It should be treasured & protected. Whether it's the sculpture of the "family" that adorn the outside, the limestone & granite masonry, the interior murals or the beautiful almost luminescent dome, people should see this work of art. My favorite has always been the terra cotta molding/ sculpture that adorn the pillars.

data.title: neat building for architecture buffs
data.text: The Woodbury county courthouse is a neat building for an architecture buff to see - beautiful domed main area. Neat brickwork inside and out. Not much there to see for anyone else.

data.title: Nice Interior
data.text: Although not worth going out of the way to see (unless you happen to be a felon going on trial), the interior of this building is quite beautiful.  Great stained glass windows and heavily paneled walls.

data.title: Breathtaking facade.
data.text: The beauty of the outside of the building was matched only by how the city and county officials came together to preserve such a beautiful building.

data.title: Truly a treasure
data.text:
My wife and I have been married for 31 years and I have visited her family in Sioux City several times but was very surprised a few months ago when we had to go to the Courthouse which also houses the County offices. 

We had to obtain a death certificate of a relative and had planned to be in and out very quickly. But the building is fascinating and has quite a history from an architectural standpoint. It is a National Historic Landmark in the Prairie School style.

From a distance the exterior is not particularly interesting but up close it is quite interesting. With its stained glass and terra cotta both inside and out as well as the exterior sculptures and murals it is well worth a detour if you are in the area.

data.title: Prairie School Architecture at it's best
data.text: A gem in the middle of Sioux City. A "Prairie School" architecture masterpiece that is still a functioning courthouse.  Built in the years right after World War I, some of the murals commemorate the men and women that served and died during the conflict.  A nice display of musical instruments and memorabilia from the American Legion Band, Monahan Post.  Go upstairs and take a peek at the actual courtrooms too.  The use of light, color and stone is amazing.

data.title: Always crabby workers
data.text: Unfriendly workers who make any interaction unpleasant.  Granted, they work with A-holes all day, but you knew that when you took the job. Smile every once in a while!

data.title: Not much to see for historical value
data.text: THis is listed as a historical site, however there is minimal information inside, its still a functioning facility, but it needs a very thurough cleaning and maybe some information posted about the facilities. I know they do tours for schools, but I have been there for other reasons, and tho it has history, theres not much to the significance of why, other than its old and has been here awhile.

data.title: Amazingly beautiful; it's on the national register of historic landmarks
data.text: From the outside, this courthouse is attractive.  The inside will take your breath away.  Beatiful stained glass, including a massive rotunda, provides beautiful daytime lighting.  The light fixtures, though not necessary on a sunny day, are gorgeous examples of early 20th century glass work.  The stonework, the woodwork, the murals--everything fits the design of this Prairie School masterpiece.
